tips.title: What is Bio-waste?
tips.content: Bio-waste refers to biodegradable waste such as food scraps, garden waste, and manure that can be composted or converted into biogas.

tips.title: Segregate Waste Properly
tips.content: Always separate bio-waste from plastics and other non-biodegradables to help the environment and improve recycling efficiency.

tips.title: Composting at Home
tips.content: You can compost food waste like fruit peels, vegetable scraps, and eggshells to create organic fertilizer for your garden.

tips.title: Use Biodegradable Bags
tips.content: When disposing of bio-waste, use compostable or biodegradable bags instead of plastic to prevent pollution.

tips.title: Avoid Contamination
